conclusion: Analyze forces on hemispheres using angle and friction conditions to find dynamic friction factor.
Two hemispheres A and B between vertical walls; A has mass m, B has mass 2m; line between centers makes 30° angle with horizontal; friction between A and left wall.
Line between centers forms 30° angle, vertical component is √3/2 times horizontal component.
Weight of hemisphere A is mg, weight of hemisphere B is 2mg, total weight is 3mg.
Static frictional force fs = μs × N, where μs is coefficient of static friction and N is normal force.
Maximum static friction equals sliding friction, so μs = μk.
Dynamic frictional force fk = μk × N.
Dynamic friction factor μk is determined by ratio of dynamic frictional force to normal force, which is 3√3/2.
